newsitem.title: USA: Nestcape says browser holds industry record.
newsitem.headline: Nestcape says browser holds industry record.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp Chief Executive James Barksdale claimed on Tuesday that the company's Internet browser, the Netscape Navigator, has outsold all other computer applications in history.
Speaking at the Networld+Interop conference, Barksdale said in a keynote speech that Netscape has downloaded 40 million copies of its Navigator software to customers, all within 19 months.
"That's more copies than any computer application in history," he said.

"That's more than Microsoft Word by 10 million copies; that's 10 million more copies than (International Business Machines Corp's ) Lotus 1-2-3; that's 10 million more copies than Microsoft Excel," Barksdale added.
"And the difference is, it was done over a period of 19 months. Those other products were 10-plus years in development and delivery, and hundreds of millions of dollars in marketing," he said.
Barksdale expounded on the advantages to corporations posed by software, such as Netscape's AppFoundry, which gives Internet-style capabilities to in-house computer networks.
